choices.D: a trusted identity provider that uses claims-based authentication
choices.A: a target application that uses a Target Application Type of Group
choices.C: a trusted identity provider that uses SAML
choices.B: a target application that uses a Target Application Type of Individual

questions.question_text:
You have a SharePoint Server farm that contains a Secure Store Service application and a Business Data Connectivity (BDC) service application. You have a site named Marketing that is used by all the users in the marketing department.
You have an OData service named Service1 that is used only by the users in the marketing department. Service1 requires authentication. The identity used to access Service1 is managed by Service1.
You need to ensure that users can create a list in SharePoint Server that accesses data from Service1.
What should you create first?

discussion.content:
Use the following procedure to create a target application.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/administration/configure-the-secure-store-service#create-a-target-application

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You have a SharePoint Server farm.
You need to create a page that will display the 20 most recently modified documents from all the site collections in the farm. The results must be displayed in table format. The page must load as quickly as possible.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move all actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:

discussion.content:
1. Add Content Search Webpart
2.Create a copy of itemtemplate named displaytemplate.html
3. Publish displaytemplate.html

1.Create a copy itemtemplate named DisplayTemplate.html and implement the page design.
2. Create a new master page
3. Add a Content Search web part

questions.question_text:
You have a SharePoint Server farm.
You have a term set named Departments.
You need to promote Departments to be used for managed navigation.
Which setting should you modify from the Terms Store Management Tool?

discussion.content: You can allow this term set for site navigation by selecting check box. Allow Use this Term set for Faceted Navigation to configures contextual refiners (faceted navigation).
In new term set, have different stages of settings like Term set Usage which can have the many different use cases. You can hide or display tabs at time of edit term set user will able to see it.
I took the exam today and this series of questions were there, but this specific question wasn't. I think this question has been removed.
Answer should be A. It's just a connection filter setting
I think this shoul be A

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than once correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You have an on-premises SharePoint Server 2019 farm that is configured to import user profiles from Active Directory by using SharePoint Active Directory import
(AD import).
You need to prevent all disabled users from being imported into SharePoint user profiles.
Solution: From the Profile Import Connection page, you modify the profile import connection.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Set up SharePoint Active Directory Import

15.If you want to filter out users that are disabled in AD DS, select the Filter out disabled users checkbox.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/administration/configure-profile-synchronization-by-using-sharepoint-active-directory-import
I would also say answer B. Since SharePoint 2016 you get an error on clicking "edit connection filter".

Answer should be B. The referenced article is not for AD import. Refer to this article below for AD import.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/administration/configure-profile-synchronization-by-using-sharepoint-active-directory-import

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than once correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

You have an on-premises SharePoint Server 2019 farm that is configured to import user profiles from Active Directory by using SharePoint Active Directory import
(AD import).
You need to prevent all disabled users from being imported into SharePoint user profiles.
Solution: From the Profile Import Connection page, you add connection filters.
Does this meet the goal?
